mechanics.condition: Line of attack/effect passes through the wall

mechanics.trigger: Creature attempts to move through wall's space
mechanics.condition: Creature is within the wall's 5-foot thick space
mechanics.outcome: Wall's space is difficult terrain (each 1 foot of movement costs 2 feet)

mechanics.trigger: Creature enters wall's area for the first time on a turn OR starts its turn in wall area
mechanics.condition: Creature fails a Dexterity saving throw

mechanics.trigger: Creature enters wall's area for the first time on a turn OR starts its turn in wall area
mechanics.condition: Creature succeeds on a Dexterity saving throw
mechanics.outcome: Creature takes half damage (3d10 slashing damage)

description_text: You create a vertical wall of whirling, razor-sharp blades made of magical energy. The wall appears within range and lasts for the duration. You can make a straight wall up to 100 feet long, 20 feet high, and 5 feet thick, or a ringed wall up to 60 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 5 feet thick. The wall provides three-quarters cover to creatures behind it, and its space is difficult terrain. When a creature enters the wall's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the creature must make a dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 6d10 slashing damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.
